Activity: Arrive at work, get settled, and enjoy a cup of green tea. Listen to a calming nature sounds playlist.
Check the help desk system for updates on the escalated issues from yesterday (@RN-1 data sync, @MRS-2 archived record). Review any new tickets that came in overnight.
Follow up on the @RN-1 data syncing issue. If @EHRDEV-1 has provided a fix or workaround, test it thoroughly in a test environment before deploying it to the live system.
If the fix works, schedule a convenient time with @RN-1 to implement it on their workstation. Provide clear instructions on how to verify that the syncing is now working correctly.
Document the solution to the data syncing issue in the internal knowledge base for future reference. Close the help desk ticket.
Address a new ticket from @CLINLEAD-1 reporting that a specific report is failing to generate in the EHR. Try to generate the report myself to reproduce the issue.

Troubleshoot the report generation failure. Check the EHR system's error logs, review the report's configuration, and verify the data source is available. Perhaps this would be a good time to ask @DA-1 if they have seen similar issues.
Lunch break. Take a walk outside in the hospital garden.
Continue investigating the report generation issue. If the problem persists, gather detailed information about the report (name, parameters, error messages) and escalate it to @DA-2 and @ITPM-1.
Follow up on the @MRS-2 archived record access issue. If @DBA-1 has identified a permission problem, work with them to grant the appropriate access to @MRS-2.
Once access is restored, verify with @MRS-2 that they can now access the record. Document the solution in the knowledge base and close the ticket.
A new ticket has arrived. @RN-2 reports a problem with the patient portal login. Guide the user through resetting their password and verifying their account information.
Address smaller, quick-fix tickets to keep the queue moving.
Check for any announcements or updates from the EHR vendor (@EHRV-1) regarding system maintenance or known issues. Share this information with relevant team members if necessary.
Prepare a summary of the day's activities and plan for tomorrow.
